page.title: 08CHESHIRE HOME, MARAZION
page.content: St.Teresa's Cheshire Home for {physically disabled people}is one of many{residential nursing {homes}in Great Britain founded by Group Captain Cheshire, a bomber pilot in the Second World War. The home was built in 1956 on land given by Lord St.Levan. The site covers about 5 acres and has a view across Mount's Bay. There are 21 single rooms and a 4-bed mini-ward. There are also some "holiday beds", and some "day-care" patients. There are about thirty staff.The home is very attractive and peaceful, and purpose built for disabled people. It has a small chapel, day room, occupational therapy room, swimming pool and a minibus for transport. There are many visitors and social activites.
